page.title: 19THE LIFEBOAT IN THE W WIGHT
page.content: We have a lifeboat service in West Wight. It is a fairly new boat.The journeys take 3-4 hours. They use flares for signals.The crew enjoy all the journeys,which sometimes are frightening. The lifeboat costs about Â£0.4M.Every time they go in the life- boat they need lifejackets since it is just as easy for them to fall into the water as it is for us.If a wave hits the lifejacket it will not leave you due to 2 straps.If anyone falls into the water without special clothing they can't expect to last more than 25mins.The lifeboat has been here for 7 years weighing 32 tons and is 35ft tall and 52ft long.It takes a 7 man crew.The lifeboat saves many lives every year,the highest amount in the W.Wight in a day is 5.Once they saved a girl and they used up 150 flares. Claire Pacey 9 years.
